image.altText: Donald Trump holds onto Elon Musk's hand with both of his own hands.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump warns Elon Musk could face "serious consequences" if his former ally and campaign benefactor tries to help Democrats in upcoming elections.

title.children: Trump warns Musk of 'serious consequences' if he backs Democrats at midterms

image.altText: A black bed frame with dark sheets and a small table lamp nearby lit up in darkness.

props.synopsis: "Are you losing sleep tonight, like I am?" They're not just the lyrics to a country music heartbreaker but a question Australians should be asking each other to avoid some major health issues.

title.children: 'Every cell, every organ': The rising health issue affecting 40 per cent of Australians

image.altText: Mugshot of a woman with blonde hair

props.synopsis: Lucy Letby is currently serving multiple life sentences after being convicted of murdering seven babies and attempting to kill others. There's only one problem: the group of experts saying there's no evidence of wrongdoing.

title.children: Convicted baby killer Lucy Letby is in prison for life. There's just one problem

image.altText: Ahmad Awad holds a pen as he looks up from his desk in a makeshift classroom.

props.synopsis: With many of Gaza's schools damaged, destroyed or turned into shelters, makeshift classrooms have been set up in tents for the few children who can continue their education amidst the ongoing war.

title.children: With schools destroyed or used as shelter, many Gazan kids learn in tents

image.altText: Black smoking brick building with some floors collapsed in.

props.synopsis: Two waves of Russian attacks targeting the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv kill at least four, injuring more, as hopes of peace dim.

title.children: Russian drone and missile strike hits key Ukraine city, dimming peace hopes

image.altText: A full street with people marching with flags and signs . one says liberation freedom restitution.

props.synopsis: Mr White died last Tuesday after he was restrained by off-duty officers on the floor of a Coles supermarket in Alice Springs.

title.children: 'We ask for justice': Hundreds rally in Brisbane over death of Kumanjayi White

image.altText: Coco Gauf kisses the French Open trophy, with orange clay court in the background

props.synopsis: Coco Gauff continues a spectacular season for American women at the grand slams, battling from a set down to topple world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the French Open final.

title.children: Gauff dedicates French Open win to 'Americans who look like me'

image.altText: Three different polaroid images of the same young girl

props.synopsis: Police confirm they have discovered human remains near the Good Night National Park near Gin Gin.

title.children: Police confirm human remains found in search for missing teen Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: A white middle-aged couple sitting together, smiling, at a timber dining table, a mantle holding ceramic objects behind them

props.synopsis: Three years after the sudden death of her husband, author Geraldine Brooks retreated to Flinders Island to do the work of grief.

title.children: Why Geraldine Brooks went to Flinders Island to mourn her husband

image.altText: Pine trees line a hill next to a river with mountains in the distance.

props.synopsis: The US president plans to open up fossil fuel extraction in the Alaskan wilderness but big oil and gas have not exactly been champing at the bit.

title.children: Trump loves Alaska oil plans but critics urge him to 'think, baby, think'

image.altText: A young Thai man looks towards the camera.

props.synopsis: Pinta Nattapong, 35, was working in Israel as a farm worker when he was kidnapped from Kibbutz Nir Oz and killed in captivity shortly afterwards, according to the Israeli government.

title.children: Israel retrieves body of Thai hostage kidnapped during October 7 attacks

image.altText: A boy wearing black and a traditional waistmat walks between two windows shaped like a crucifix at a church.

props.synopsis: Tonga is so serious about the Sabbath that it banned most Sunday trading. Now the king and police are urging people to keep the day holy.

title.children: Tonga strictly keeps the Sabbath. Some say it's gone too far

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: So much of politics is the art of compromise. It's an art form the Victorian Liberals are unwilling to practice as the party once again rips itself apart over the fate of former leader John Pesutto.

title.children: Victoria's Liberals struggles with compromise as infighting continues

image.altText: Protest sign at World Pride

props.synopsis: Washington DC was chosen as host city for WorldPride before last year's re-election of Donald Trump. But his presence in the White House has sent a strong fight-the-government theme running through all its events.

title.children: WorldPride Washington strikes a protest note on Trump's doorstep

image.altText: A man standing in front of a house.

props.synopsis: Don James is the "talk of the town" after his extraordinary fight with a kangaroo, and learns a valuable lesson about how stressed animals can react after significant disruption to their habitats.

title.children: Man survives fight with stressed roo by throwing 'backward elbows'

image.altText: A frowning woman with curly blonde hair and wearing a blue shirt sits in front of an open laptop.

props.synopsis: A clinical psychologist warns that winter rain will not "wash away the worries" caused by severe drought across southern Australia.

title.children: More farmers seek mental health support as drought a 'daily rollercoaster'

image.altText: A man stands upright on a small watercraft, with another man with a ponytail with his back towards camera, during dusk

props.synopsis: Lachlan, Ewan and Jamie Maclean have almost reached the halfway point in their 14,000-kilometre journey across the Pacific Ocean.

title.children: Three Scottish brothers near halfway in world record rowing attempt

image.altText: Fans holding signs.

props.synopsis: There is a male audience for women's sport, but football experts believe there is still a long way to go when it comes to universal respect for sporting talent.

title.children: 'Built by men, for men': Push to change perceptions of women's sport

image.altText: GWS captain Toby Greene holds his hip in discomfort as he limps on the ground with a trainer during a game.

props.synopsis: GWS fall short in Canberra without injured skipper Toby Greene, putting their top-eight spot in jeopardy as the Power grab vital win on the road for coach Ken Hinkley.

title.children: Giants fall short in Canberra without Greene as Power win one for Hinkley

image.altText: Titans NRL players look on during loss to Broncos at Lang Park.

props.synopsis: Reflecting on the 44-14 defeat to the Broncos, Titans coach Des Hasler describes his side's first half as the "most disappointing 40 minutes" they have played this year.

title.children: 'No excuse': Hasler blasts Titans after humiliating loss to Broncos

image.altText: A bull shark swims towards camera in an all ocean blue background other sharks silhouetted in distance

props.synopsis: The KPMG report stresses that while “traditional measures” are still required, the program needs to transition away from “environmentally harmful practices”, such as drumlines and mesh nets.

title.children: Queensland shark control plan goes against government commissioned advice

image.altText: A selfie of Leannedra Kang and Takahiro Toya with a view of Hobart below them

props.synopsis: Police have discovered a crashed car and what are believed to be the bodies of tourists Leannedra Kang and Takahiro Toya two days after the couple were due home in Queensland.

title.children: Tasmanian police find bodies in search for missing Queensland couple

image.altText: Aerial view of trees and water in Lake Eyre.

props.synopsis: Lake Eyre being full is not just a once-in-a-lifetime moment it's also a chance for outback towns to feast on tourism.

title.children: Lake Eyre comes alive as floodwaters help with once in a generation fill

image.altText: Tottenham Hotspur head coach Ange Postecoglou looks on during the post-season friendly match

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou flew into the Spurs job on a wing and a prayer, and surpassed expectations immediately. But longstanding structural issues and Postecoglou's own pigheadedness ensured a reversion to Tottenham's 'Spursy' norm.

title.children: Ange's Spurs sacking the sad reality for awful league campaign

image.altText: Simone Biles smiling, holding the gold medal around her neck, on the Olympic podium

props.synopsis: Olympic gymnast Simone Biles has called former US college swimmer Riley Gaines "sick" for mocking a social media post about a high school softball team with a trans player.

title.children: 'Straight up sore loser': Biles calls out former swimmer for trans stance

image.altText: An old building with blue mesh fencing around it and trees

props.synopsis: Derelict Queensland island resorts that were once playgrounds for the rich and famous are facing a state government takeover, amid frustrations they have been used for land banking.

title.children: Paradise lost: Queensland's derelict island resorts face government takeover

image.altText: A photo of an Aldi sign

props.synopsis: It's no secret that Aldi sells products visually similar to those of its well-established competitors. But using Australian courts to force the retailer to change its ways is no easy task.

title.children: How Aldi sails 'close to the wind' on branding and packaging

image.altText: Ukrainian soldiers walk after a POWs exchange between Russia and Ukraine

props.synopsis: Russia says 1,212 bodies of Ukrainian soldiers were ready in refrigerated containers at the exchange point and Ukrainian officials were supposed to take them — but Ukraine says no date had been agreed to.

title.children: Russia accuses Ukraine of postponing exchange of soldiers' bodies

image.altText: A close up of Harvey Weinstein.

props.synopsis: Jurors are deliberating after hearing six weeks of evidence in the New York retrial of Harvey Weinstein. Here's how it unfolded.

title.children: What happened at Harvey Weinstein's New York rape and sexual assault retrial

image.altText: A satellite image shows three destroyed aircraft sitting on a tarmac that runs between verdants strips of grass and trees.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin's online army is normally supportive, but some accounts have been boldly outspoken and willing to question, even blame, the Russian establishment for not protecting the country's prized strategic bomber fleet.

title.children: As Russian planes burned, Putin's military bloggers were 'choking with hurt'

image.altText: A young woman, smiling, and kicking up snow.

props.synopsis: Alpine resorts could not be happier with up to 19 centimetres of fresh snow recorded overnight — and more snow to come.

title.children: Fresh snow marks the official opening of the Victorian ski season

image.altText: A police image of a blue Subaru Liberty believed to have been involved in the collision.

props.synopsis: Police are seeking assistance after a Chinese national on holiday in Melbourne was struck in an alleged hit-run and left with two broken legs.

title.children: Police appeal for help after alleged hit-run that broke pedestrian's legs

image.altText: A dark skinned man wearing black sunglasses with pursed lips

props.synopsis: A woman who was dating Sean "Diddy" Combs at the time of his arrest last year has broken down in tears while giving evidence at his trial.

title.children: Sean Combs's sobbing ex-girlfriend testifies at trial

image.altText: School building with red open sign out the front of it

props.synopsis: When Geranium Primary School was forced to close its doors due to dwindling enrolment numbers, it shut a century-old chapter for the tiny town. But then one former teacher with big dreams stepped in to her help her town blossom again.

title.children: Town of 80 buys old primary school for $1.10 and turns it into op shop
